Thursday 16th October

10am – 1pm

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”1″ divider_color=”default” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][image_with_animation image_url=”22202″ image_size=”full” max_width=”100%” max_width_mobile=”default” animation_type=”entrance” animation=”Fade In” animation_easing=”default” animation_movement_type=”transform_y” hover_animation=”none” alignment=”” border_radius=”none” box_shadow=”none” image_loading=”default”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1754924749991{margin-top: 30px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}” text_direction=”default”]Black Fashion & Beauty Talks celebrate the intersection of creativity, entrepreneurship, and Black excellence in the fashion and beauty industries. This event brings together industry leaders, visionary entrepreneurs, and creative innovators to share the strategies that have pushed them to the forefront of their fields.

Through engaging discussions, trend forecasting, and authentic insights, attendees will learn how to build brands that resonate, connect meaningfully with customers, and build exciting careers in these growing industries.

Whether you’re launching your first collection, leading an international brand, or exploring career opportunities, this event delivers the insider knowledge needed to thrive in competitive markets. Join this event to gain invaluable connections and learn from those who have mastered the art of transforming creative vision into commercial success.

Key themes:
1. Explore entry points into the fashion and beauty industry and what it takes to stand out to global brands
2. Understand the entrepreneurial journey from concept to launch to scale, and how to secure funding, ensure brand visibility, and master operational excellence in production and supply chains
3. Learn how brands harness the power of influencers, social media, and ecommerce marketplaces to reach new consumers and convert them to loyal customers
4. Discover how fashion and beauty brands operate on an international scale, while maintaining a seamless customer experience in all markets
5. Transform a creative vision in a profitable, scalable business that celebrates Black excellence and delivers innovative products for underserved markets[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”No Line” Donna Dia

Founder, The Beauty Beat[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Donna Dia is a luxury events specialist with 15 years’ experience creating and executing experiences that engage and inspire. Her flair for events lies in the passion, skill, and impeccable taste she brings to every stage of the production process – whether devising innovative concepts, curating content, securing talent, project managing digital campaigns, or finessing the final details for that five-star feel.

From curating bespoke beauty and fashion events to producing large-scale consumer experiences, gala dinners for the Royal Family, star-studded red carpet film premieres and show-stopping installations, Donna brings her inimitable mix of creative oversight, strategic acumen, and exceptional logistical skills to deliver seamless, premium events loved by brands and guests alike.

Most recently, Donna has combined her years of luxury event experience with one of her main passions – championing and celebrating Women of Colour, with the Beauty Beat, a one-of-its-kind cultural sensation.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ divider_color=”accent-color” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” Karl Patterson

Senior Manager, Diversity & Inclusion, Tapestry[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

With over 10 years of experience in ED&I, Karl is passionate about creating inclusive cultures where diverse talent thrives. He specialises in amplifying lived experiences, using data to drive impactful storytelling, and embedding inclusion as a strategic imperative—not a checkbox. He is proud to be on a continuous journey of change, championing equity inside and outside organisations.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ divider_color=”accent-color” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Yinka Ash

Founder & CEO, Ashcorp Group[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Yinka Ash is one of the most influential figures in fashion. A visionary entrepreneur, cultural architect, and the driving force behind Ashcorp Group, Yinka is redefining what luxury means on the global stage.

In 2017, he launched Ashluxury, a pioneering concept store that redefined luxury retail in Nigeria. He introduced high-end fashion to Nigerian and African high-net-worth consumers, creating an ecosystem where global luxury could thrive in Africa. Through his relentless innovation, deep cultural storytelling, and business strategy, he has built a multi-million-dollar empire.

Building on this momentum, he launched Ashluxe in 2019, an original luxury streetwear brand that fuses  African culture with contemporary aesthetics. From Lagos to London, Ashluxe is worn by global trendsetters, artists, and fashion connoisseurs who embrace its cultural DNA.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ divider_color=”accent-color” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Emile Vidal Carr

Award Winning Fashion Design Director, Author & Creative Director[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Creativity comes as second nature to Sierra Leonean-born Emile Vidal Carr. His attention to detail in celebrating the female form through his designs has allowed him to explore and strengthen his capabilities. He has worked in the technical room for Alexander McQueen, Victoria Beckham, Ralph & Russo and Kanye West, as well as running design projects Ferrari, Novikov Restaurant and Squid Games The Challenge.

After graduating from the London College of Fashion, Emile designed a range that was stocked by market leaders Topshop, ASOS, and Allders, and in 2008, had the opportunity to showcase a collection as part of New York Fashion Week. Fast forward to decades, and he has become one of London’s most sought-after designers. His brand is one of a few UK labels that set up and own their factory in south London.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ divider_color=”accent-color” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” Vanessa Simpson

Brand Manager, Crème of Nature & Revlon Hair [/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Vanessa Simpson is the Brand Manager for Crème of Nature UK, where she leads the brand’s 360° marketing strategy across the UK market. Her remit includes driving impactful brand and influencer partnerships, executing media campaigns, and delivering engaging retailer activations that resonate with the textured haircare community.

With over 4 years professional experience in the textured haircare industry, Vanessa has successfully managed multiple brand and product launches, and spearheaded collaborations with key industry players. Her work reflects a deep understanding of the market and a commitment to elevating representation and innovation within the beauty space.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” text_direction=”default”]

Vanessa Vanderpuye

Actress & Model[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Vanessa Vanderpuye is an award-winning British actress, model, and content creator. She won Best Actor at the American Black Film Festival for A Song From the Dark and has earned multiple Best Actress nominations, including the BAFTA winning series Dreaming Whilst Black.

With a portfolio spanning global campaigns for L’Oréal, Coca-Cola, Pantene, and Colgate, Vanessa is also a model and digital creator. Passionate about storytelling, representation, and empowering diverse voices, she continues to build an international career across film, television, and brand partnerships.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ divider_color=”accent-color” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” Tilly Prowse

Senior PR, VIP & Influencer Manager, EMEAI, Coach & Kate Spade[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Tilly Prowse is a PR and communications professional with 10 years of experience within the luxury fashion industry. Over the past decade, she’s led high-profile activations and global campaigns across events, influencer partnerships, communications, and cultural strategy for brands such as Loro Piana, TOTEME, Khatie NY, Self-Portrait, The Fashion Awards, Fiorucci, Coach and Kate Spade NY among others.

Tilly has had the privilege of contributing to some of fashion’s most dynamic moments, from global fashion weeks to regional market launches. She’s passionate about creating space for diverse voices in fashion and championing authentic self-expression. She believes in building community, nurturing young talent, and using creativity as a bridge between brands and culture.

[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ divider_color=”accent-color” animate=”yes” custom_height=”20″][vc_row_inner equal_height=”yes” content_placement=”middle” Janet Davies

Black British Business Awards Finalist & Founder, Ominira Naturals[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Janet has always challenged the rhetoric that “Afro hair doesn’t grow”. For over a decade, she has mastered the most effective ways to maximise growth and length retention. Out of this passion, Ominira Naturals was born—with a mission to empower, equip, and educate women with products, tools, and methods that allow Afro hair to truly thrive. Every product is formulated with Black women’s health in mind, without the toxic chemicals that endanger our wellbeing

What makes Janet’s journey extraordinary is that she built Ominira while raising two children under two, scaling to £1.5M in sales in just three years with a 73% customer return rate. These results highlight both the demand for, and the impact of, Black-owned hair care brands that personally identify with the issues at play and create category-defining solutions women cannot live without.

Abibat Adesanya

Beauty Creator & Content Strategist[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Abibat is a multidisciplinary creator and storyteller redefining modern beauty culture. With a degree in Politics and International Relations and a background as a management consultant, she brings strategy and storytelling together to spark meaningful change for brands and her audience.

With over 160,000+ across platforms, she celebrates the beauty, history, and innovation of natural hair, centering Black women and their stories while blending culture, community, and creativity to empower others to love, learn, and experiment with their texture.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Width Line” line_thickness=”2″ divider_color=”accent-color” animate=”yes” Timi Dorgu

Head of eCommerce Acceleration, L’Oréal [/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Timi Dorgu is a former winner of The Rising Star accolade at the Black British Business Awards and works as Head of eCommerce Acceleration at L’Oréal UK and Ireland within the Professional Products Division. He joined the company 15 years ago as an intern and then progressed to Graduate Management Trainee, before becoming Regional Sales Manager and now progressing to his current role. Timi is passionate 

about developing the future generation. He volunteers as a school governor at two secondary schools, leads his family Foundation’s work supporting young people in North London, and serves as a mentor to many.[/vc_column_text][divider Yemicita

Style Consultant for Founders & Leaders[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Yemicita is a fashion stylist with a background in banking, working as a Procurement Specialist by day while pursuing her passion for helping ambitious women founders look and feel their best. She has styled high-profile entrepreneurs including Ama Agyei (Plantmade), Aimee Smale (Odd Muse), and Olivia Louise (D. Louise Jewellery), supporting them with both founder event looks and everyday looks. With a unique ability to merge creativity and professionalism, Yemicita empowers female leaders to elevate their style as a powerful extension of their brand. She believes that how you show up influences not just perception, but confidence and impact and her mission is to help women own every room they step into.[/vc_column_text][divider line_type=”Full Gbemi Okunlola

Founder & Creative Director, Alonuko[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]Established in 2012 – at just 17 years old – by British-born Nigerian designer Oluwagbemisola “Gbemi” Okunlola, Alonuko specialises in bespoke bridalwear and ready-to-wear evening designs, crafted and managed by an in-house team of 20 skilled professionals. With a mission to empower women through exceptional design, Alonuko blends cultural significance, luxury, and scalability to address evolving market needs.

Operating from its London headquarters, Alonuko is a trailblazing women’s luxury brand generating annual revenues exceeding £1 million. From humble beginnings in Peckham, where Gbemi taught herself to sew at the age of 11 after watching her mother create gowns, Alonuko has grown into an internationally recognised brand. Through its studio in London, online platform, trunk shows and global pop-ups, the brand provides access to its exclusive designs, catering to a diverse and international clientele.
